title: Delete caffe2_cuda_full_device_control
body_html:
Stack:
    ⚪️  #14191 Add hash functions for Stream, CUDAStream; fix Device hash function  💛
    ⚪️  #14246 Delete legacy THCStream (long live THCStream).  💛
    ⚪️  #14247 Clean up house on CUDAStream  💛
    ⚪️  #14248 Move CUDAGuard, CUDAStream and CUDAGuardImpl to c10/cuda  💛
    ⚪️  #14282 Replace use of 'int' with more descriptive 'DeviceIndex' or 'StreamId'.  💛
    ⚫️  #14283 Delete caffe2_cuda_full_device_control  💛
    ⚪️  #14284 Replace caffe2::DeviceGuard with c10::cuda::CUDAGuard  💛

According to Yangqing, this code was only used by us to do some end-to-end
performance experiments on the impact of cudaSetDevice and cudaGetDevice. Now
that the frameworks are merged, there are a lot of bare calls to those functions
which are not covered by this flag. It doesn't seem like a priority to restore
this functionality, so I am going to delete it for now. If you want to bring
it back, you'll have to make all get/set calls go through this particular
interfaces.

Differential Revision: D13156472

body:
Stack:
    :white_circle:  #14191 Add hash functions for Stream, CUDAStream; fix Device hash function  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13119624/)
    :white_circle:  #14246 Delete legacy THCStream (long live THCStream).  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13121531/)
    :white_circle:  #14247 Clean up house on CUDAStream  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13141949/)
    :white_circle:  #14248 Move CUDAGuard, CUDAStream and CUDAGuardImpl to c10/cuda  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13145293/)
    :white_circle:  #14282 Replace use of 'int' with more descriptive 'DeviceIndex' or 'StreamId'.  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13156471/)
    :black_circle:  **#14283 Delete caffe2_cuda_full_device_control**  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13156472/)
    :white_circle:  #14284 Replace caffe2::DeviceGuard with c10::cuda::CUDAGuard  [:yellow_heart:](https://our.internmc.facebook.com/intern/diff/D13156470/)

According to Yangqing, this code was only used by us to do some end-to-end
performance experiments on the impact of cudaSetDevice and cudaGetDevice.  Now
that the frameworks are merged, there are a lot of bare calls to those functions
which are not covered by this flag.  It doesn't seem like a priority to restore
this functionality, so I am going to delete it for now.  If you want to bring
it back, you'll have to make all get/set calls go through this particular
interfaces.
